author: Evelyn Baker
title: Renewal by Andersen Acclaims Highest Customer Satisfaction Awards
text: Renewal by Andersen Acclaims Highest Customer Satisfaction Awards [Evelyn Baker](https://investorshangout.com/profile/view?id=79472)Updated: 11-07-2024 04:54 PM Renewal by Andersen's Remarkable Recognition in Customer Satisfaction Renewal by Andersen has achieved a significant milestone by being recognized as the "Highest in Customer Satisfaction with Window and Patio Door Manufacturer Brands" and the "Highest in Customer Satisfaction with Window and Patio Door Retailers" according to a recent prestigious study. This accolade from J.D. Power marks the fifth consecutive year that Renewal by Andersen has received such recognition, solidifying its position as a leading brand in the window and patio door sector. Consistent Excellence in Quality The J.D. Power study, now in its 18th year, evaluates customer satisfaction based on various performance metrics. Renewal by Andersen maintained the highest customer satisfaction ratings across multiple categories, including durability, performance, features, ease of use, appearance, and trust level. These remarkable scores highlight not just the quality of the products but also the company's commitment to excellence. A Testament to Stellar Customer Experience Furthermore, in the retail segment, Renewal by Andersen's customer experience shone brightly, receiving the highest scores in areas like digital tools, personnel interaction, store environment, product offerings, delivery, and installation processes. This comprehensive approach to customer service underscores the brand's dedication to creating a seamless experience from start to finish. Dedication to Service by Leadership Commenting on the recognition, Troy Barrow, president of Renewal by Andersen, stated, "Earning two J.D. Power awards in a single year demonstrates our dedication to delivering our exclusive Signature Service, which combines exceptional products with phenomenal customer service." These awards not only reflect the quality of the offerings but also the effort to ensure that every homeowner feels valued and satisfied with their decisions. Understanding J.D. Power's Role J.D. Power is renowned for its insights into consumer behavior and satisfaction, providing valuable intelligence to various industries for over half a century. The organization employs advanced analytics to gather insights that help companies, including Renewal by Andersen, refine their customer-facing strategies. This recognition is a powerful endorsement of the standards to which Renewal by Andersen adheres. Commitment to Environmental Sustainability Renewal by Andersen is not just a leader in customer satisfaction; it also prioritizes sustainability. The company received the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's 2024 ENERGY STAR¬Æ Partner of the Year award, which highlights their commitment to environmentally friendly practices. This dedication to sustainability, paired with superior service, positions Renewal by Andersen as an example within the window replacement industry. Conclusion In conclusion, Renewal by Andersen's latest accolades from J.D. Power reinforce its status as a top choice for customers seeking windows and patio doors. By focusing on quality, customer service, and environmental responsibility, the company continues to lead the market, ensuring homeowners are both satisfied and proud of their investments. For more information about the company and its offerings, potential customers and stakeholders can explore further online. Frequently Asked Questions What awards has Renewal by Andersen received? Renewal by Andersen has been recognized as the highest in customer satisfaction for both window and patio door manufacturers and retailers by J.D. Power for five consecutive years. What does the J.D. Power study measure? The J.D. Power study measures customer satisfaction based on various dimensions, including durability, performance, appearance, and the overall customer experience. Who is the president of Renewal by Andersen? The president of Renewal by Andersen is Troy Barrow, who emphasizes the company‚Äôs dedication to customer service and quality products. What is the significance of the ENERGY STAR¬Æ award for Renewal by Andersen? The ENERGY STAR¬Æ award from the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency highlights Renewal by Andersen's commitment to sustainability and environmentally friendly practices in the window replacement industry. Where can I learn more about Renewal by Andersen's offerings? Customers can visit Renewal by Andersen's official website to explore their products and services, including options for custom consultations and installations. It draws in traders of all levels, who exchange market knowledge, investigate trading tactics, and keep an eye on industry developments in real time. Featuring financial articles, stock message boards, quotes, charts, company profiles, and live news updates. Through cooperative learning and a wealth of informational resources, it helps users from novices creating their first portfolios to experts honing their techniques. author: https://asm.org/Biographies/ASM-Communications
title: Stony Brook University Named an ASM ‚ÄúMilestones in Microbiology‚Äù Site
text:
Stony Brook University Named an ASM ‚ÄúMilestones in Microbiology‚Äù Site
Stony Brook, N.Y. ‚Äî The American Society for Microbiology (ASM) is honored to designate the Department of Microbiology and Immunology at the Renaissance School of Medicine, Stony Brook University as a ‚ÄúMilestones in Microbiology‚Äù site for its advancements in the diagnosis and treatment of infectious diseases globally. The department will be designated as a milestones site during an Oct.17, 2024, celebration and ceremony honoring noted scientists and historic first achievements.
The ‚ÄúMilestones in Microbiology‚Äù program was established by ASM to promote greater awareness and appreciation for the microbial sciences and to stimulate interest in our microbiological heritage. The award recognizes sites where major developments and pivotal discoveries occurred.
‚ÄúASM is delighted to recognize Stony Brook University's Department of Microbiology and Immunology as a 'Milestones in Microbiology' site for its significant contributions to the microbial sciences,‚Äù said Theresa Koehler, Ph. D., ASM President. ‚ÄúThe university‚Äôs pioneering work investigating causative agents of human diseases have had far-reaching impacts in the sciences and society at large.‚Äù
Stony Brook University is a flagship research institution of the State University of New York. Since its inception, the university‚Äôs department of microbiology and immunology has been at the forefront of microbial science research, collaborating with pharmaceutical companies, government agencies and community physicians to improve the diagnosis and treatment of infectious diseases around the world. Notable accomplishments include:
- The establishment of the department of microbiology, now designated as the department of microbiology and immunology, under the leadership of Joseph Kates, Ph.D., in 1972.
- The landmark discovery by Founding Chair Kates that viruses could package enzymes required for their replication, with the first demonstration of the vaccinia virus encapsulating the DNA-dependent RNA polymerase enzyme. This laid the groundwork for targeting viral polymerases as a widespread therapeutic strategy.
- The first identification of Borrelia burgdorferi, the causative agent of Lyme disease, by Jorge Benach, Ph.D., Willy Burgdorfer, Ph.D., and scientists from the Rocky Mountain Laboratory, paved the way for successful antibiotic therapies.
- The first description of the de-novo chemical-biochemical synthesis of a virus (poliovirus) in the absence of a natural template by Eckard Wimmer, Dr. rer. nat., and the co-discovery of the human receptor for poliovirus with Vincent Racaniello, Ph.D. This marked the beginning of the total synthesis of organisms in the absence of natural templates, enabling new strategies in virus vaccine development.
Learn more about ASM‚Äôs "Milestones in Microbiology" program and how to apply for "Milestones in Microbiology" recognition.
###
The American Society for Microbiology is one of the largest professional societies dedicated to the life sciences and is composed of over 32,000 scientists and health practitioners. ASM's mission is to promote and advance the microbial sciences.
ASM advances the microbial sciences through conferences, publications, certifications, educational opportunities and advocacy efforts. It enhances laboratory capacity around the globe through training and resources. It provides a network for scientists in academia, industry and clinical settings. Additionally, ASM promotes a deeper understanding of the microbial sciences to diverse audiences.

author: Eric Striker
title: Israel Is Losing Their War, But What More Can American Do?, by Eric Striker - The Unz Review
text: Earlier this week, Iranian-backed forces launched a drone attack that killed three US soldiers at the Tower 22 outpost in the sovereign nation of Jordan. Fears of a wider regional war breaking out have never been higher. Tower 22 is a logistical safe zone within walking distance of Syria used to support the al-Tanf airbase, which is illegally situated in US-occupied Syrian territory. The al-Tanf facility, which Jewish foreign policy makers established during Operation Inherent Resolve to prevent Syrian access to the [Damascus-Baghdad highway](https://arabcenterdc.org/resource/a-us-iran-race-to-control-the-damascus-baghdad-highway/), is a permanent source of regional mischief. Multiple [intelligence services](https://thecradle.co/articles/russia-accuses-us-of-forming-army-of-extremists-in-syria), local Arab tribesmen, and [former paramilitary operatives](https://www.business-standard.com/article/news-ani/u-s-troops-at-al-tanf-base-sold-weapons-to-isis-in-syria-117090100460_1.html) employed by the CIA at al-Tanf have accused the base of being a covert training and provisions center for both [ISIS and Al-Qaeda](https://www.aa.com.tr/en/world/russian-intelligence-chief-accuses-us-of-training-daesh-isis-in-syria-for-attacks-in-russia/2905078). Fighters are given weapons, then dispatched to wreak havoc against Russian, Syrian and Iranian troops and civilians throughout Homs and Deir ez-Zor, as well as in nearby Iraqi territory. For this reason, the al-Tanf base and its surrounding 34 mile ‚Äúdeconfliction zone‚Äù has [for years](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/1/20/drone-attack-hits-us-led-coalition-base-in-southern-syria) been targeted by a myriad of actors, including the [Russian air force](https://thecradle.co/articles-id/3700). The decision from Iraqi militia members to hit al-Tanf on the less defended Jordanian side was likely intended to draw blood in revenge for the [US assassination](https://taskandpurpose.com/news/us-airstrike-baghdad-iran/) of Popular Mobilization Unit leader Mushtaq Jawad Kazim al-Jawari, who was murdered in a reckless broad daylight drone attack in front of the Iraqi government‚Äôs Interior Ministry building in early January. Joe Biden may have feigned shock and outrage in public, but it is unlikely that Washington was too surprised by the response they received for this action. Foreign policy analysts have concluded that American troop deployments in these conflict zones are intended to be provocative and soldiers are deliberately exposed to danger as [‚Äútripwires‚Äù](https://quincyinst.org/2024/01/30/u-s-troops-are-dangerously-vulnerable-in-the-middle-east/) to justify deeper US engagement on behalf of Israel. Israel Is Being Defeated Washington has exhausted almost every feasible course of action to allow Israel a freehand without any red lines against the Palestinians. Since the start of the Jewish nation‚Äôs invasion of Gaza, the US has dispatched its navy to the Eastern Mediterranean to deter Hezbollah on Israel‚Äôs northern border, on top of sending [2,000 Special Forces soldiers](https://www.thedefensepost.com/2023/10/17/us-troops-israel-hamas/) and massive arms transfers ( [including taking](https://www.axios.com/2023/10/19/us-israel-artillery-shells-ukraine-weapons-gaza) desperately needed artillery shells from the collapsing Ukrainian military) to aid Benjamin Netanyahu‚Äôs rampage. Since October 7th, the US has been relentlessly assassinating anti-Israel leaders in Iraq and Syria and [bombing facilities](https://www.cnn.com/2023/11/08/politics/us-airstrikes-eastern-syria-iran/index.html) used by the Iranian Revolutionary Guard Corps with impunity. Both Britain and the United States have launched a military campaign against the Houthis in Yemen, Operation Prosperity Guardian, to safeguard Israeli economic interests in the Red Sea at everybody else‚Äôs expense. The US and its British vassal state have functioned as Israel‚Äôs lawyer before international bodies, shielding the Jewish state from meaningful diplomatic consequences for its systematic atrocities against women and children. What new escalatory options does the Biden administration even have? So far, none of the aforementioned actions have succeeded in deterring Israel‚Äôs regional opponents, whose sole demand is that Tel Aviv stop the slaughter. Broadly speaking, Israel‚Äôs war in Gaza is failing. Casualties are mounting, [public anger](https://www.timesofisrael.com/surveys-show-gantz-holds-commanding-lead-over-netanyahu-as-war-approaches-100th-day/) is growing over Netanyahu‚Äôs ineptitude, and after 117 days of war, not a single strategic objective has been met. Politically and morally, the proud inhumanity of Jewish leaders has caused global anti-Jewish and anti-Zionist sentiment to [surge to record highs](https://www.reuters.com/world/how-surge-antisemitism-is-affecting-countries-around-world-2023-10-31/). Israeli forces have stalled in the mission of releasing any hostages outside of diplomatic channels, which is a personal embarrassment for Netanyahu. Israeli media has been reporting on stories of IDF soldiers actually killing their own people with [poison gas](https://www.972mag.com/weapons-toxic-gas-gaza-hostages/) during chemical warfare attacks against militants in Hamas tunnels. In a separate anecdote, three Jewish hostages waving white flags were [executed](https://www.npr.org/2023/12/16/1219826061/israel-hostages-gaza-hamas-palestinians) in cold blood by IDF soldiers, who confused them for Palestinian civilians from a distance. The full scope of manpower attrition in the Israeli military is a known-unknown. Following the propaganda strategy of Zelensky‚Äôs Ukraine, IDF military censors have placed an unprecedented gag on reporting casualties they have suffered so far in the war. This has demoralized Israelis who want to publicly acknowledge the dead soldiers in their families as heroes, especially since the Netanyahu government is in practice failing to contain loudening whispers of historically unprecedented losses. To get a general idea of Israeli losses in the war, an investigation by Haaretz from December found that over [10,500 IDF soldiers](https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/2023-12-10/ty-article/.premium/idf-reports-1-593-wounded-since-october-7-but-hospital-data-is-much-higher/ 18c-552d-df4b-a78e-d52f47ac0000) were admitted for battlefield wounds in hospitals. Fatalities are speculated to be in the thousands. On the Palestinian side, almost all of the casualties inflicted by Israel are militarily insignificant. At least [90% ](https://www.commondreams.org/news/gaza-civilians-killed#:~:text=Based%20on%20preliminary%20statistics%2C%20the,as%20Russia%27s%20war%20on%20Ukraine.) of the Palestinians killed by Israel are helpless civilians, with 40%, or 10,000, [being children](https://reliefweb.int/report/occupied-palestinian-territory/gaza-10000-children-killed-nearly-100-days-war#:~:text=RAMALLAH%2C%2011%20January%202023%20%E2%80%93%20More,rubble%2C%20Save%20the%20Children%20said.). This was previously unheard of in the history of warfare and an unambiguous crime against humanity under international law. By comparison, in World War II, where the Allies utilized area bombing of civilians as policy in instances such as Dresden, the ratio of civilian casualties never rose above 50%. Massacring the women, children and elderly of Gaza is a, poorly kept, secret objective in this war. Adding to Israeli woes is the military‚Äôs admission that the overwhelming majority of Hamas‚Äô 100s of miles of sophisticated tunnels remain in-tact. Videos released daily by both Hezbollah and Hamas feature Israelis standing in place in windows for snipers to pick off and their tanks, almost always lacking infantry support, rolling into obvious ambushes. The US-backed rule of [Mahmoud Abbas](https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20231022-gaza-war-heaps-pressure-on-palestinian-president-abbas) in the West Bank has been thoroughly discredited, as Israelis take out their frustration on the largely [disarmed](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/1/30/israel-troops-kill-three-palestinians-in-west-bank-hospital-ministry) West Bank. Gaza‚Äôs civilian infrastructure has suffered destruction equivalent to [Hiroshima and Nagasaki](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/longform/2023/11/9/israel-attacks-on-gaza-weapons-and-scale-of-destruction) combined, yet this has only further galvanized Palestinians to stand with Hamas, as well as giving Gaza‚Äôs army plenty of rubble to defend from. The myth that has for decades kept the Arab world paralyzed in fear, that of the [‚Äúinvincible army‚Äù](https://electronicintifada.net/content/myth-israels-invincibility-has-been-shattered/38721), has been replaced with a more accurate image of a third world military wielding first world American and European weapons. In Northern Gaza, which Netanyahu has clung to as evidence that he is making progress in the war, it was just [announced](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2024/jan/30/hamas-returns-northern-gaza-new-offensive) that Israeli forces are being forced to pull out and Hamas is back in charge. Jewish settlers and Kibbutzim refuse to return to the areas around Gaza, one of many symbolic victories for the Palestinians fighting to take back their land. Realistically, there is no option left in Gaza other than diplomacy. The US government ‚Äî represented by the Jews Antony Blinken and Amos Hochstein ‚Äî is now offering negotiations with the Palestinians in hopes of applying a tourniquet to Israel‚Äôs setbacks. This has all the trappings of a familiar scam. US-Israel is currently offering safe passage to Hamas‚Äô leadership to third countries as well as a temporary two-month ceasefire in exchange for all of the hostages, but everybody knows Israel will simply assassinate these leaders and continue bombing Gaza at a later date. There are even reports emerging that the US may be dangling the prospect of [ establishing a Palestinian state](https://www.middleeasteye.net/news/us-weighing-options-recognise-palestinian-state-report) in front of Hamas, though only on the absurd condition that it is demilitarized and placed under the bought off and unpopular Palestinian Authority‚Äôs rule. It is unlikely the Palestinians will give up their main bargaining chip ‚Äî Jewish hostages ‚Äî easily, and it would be suicidal for them to do so. The experience of the [Oslo Accords](https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2013/sep/12/oslo-israel-reneged-colonial-palestine) is burned in the Palestinian people‚Äôs national memory. They have good reason to believe that as soon as Israel gets what they want, they will violate every term of an agreement with full US-backing and pick up their ruthless [war of ethnic cleansing](https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/israeli-ministers-join-ultranationalist-conference-urging-gaza-resettlement-2024-01-29/) where it left off. The Biden administration is committed to playing hardball, as seen by the sudden decision to cut off access to food and medicine. The goal is to make Palestinians more compliant in these bad faith talks. This week the United States and its satellite states announced that they would defund the UNRWA, which the head of the United Nations warned [would be catastrophic](https://www.politico.com/video/2024/01/31/un-chief-asks-countries-to-resume-unrwa-funding-despite-allegations-1204006) for already suffering Palestinian civilians. The bogus pretense given by Blinken for this decision is that Israeli interrogators uncovered evidence that UN relief workers, who are being [indiscriminately killed](https://www.theguardian.com/global-development/2023/nov/06/israel-hamas-war-deadliest-for-un-aid-workers-agency-leaders-ceasefire-call) while engaging in humanitarian work in Gaza, are secretly members of Hamas. This narrative was almost certainly extracted through torture. Shin Bet agents have been [arbitrarily snatching](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/israel-hamas-war-prisoners-allegations-abuse-beatings-torture-rcna134280) up any Palestinian ‚Äî journalists, laborers, UN employed medical staff ‚Äî they have access to and subjecting them to incommunicado detention, where prisoners are brutally beaten, deprived of sleep, denied food and water, and sodomized with metal objects. Victims of Israeli torture routinely [die](https://www.middleeasteye.net/news/israel-palestine-war-freed-palestinian-children-fellow-prisoners-tortured-death) in captivity. US, Israel and Lebanon If a peace deal is successfully brokered in the Israel-Hamas conflict, it should not be automatically assumed that a wider regional war has been averted, as the Israeli military buildup on Lebanon‚Äôs border suggests. Some in the Arab world have criticized Hezbollah‚Äôs patient strategy in Israel‚Äôs north as too meager, but this is a misread. Hezbollah has effectively utilized a miniscule fraction of its resources to engage in tit-for-tat exchanges harassing Israeli forces, which has effectively forced the Jewish army to divide its military between its border and Gaza. The pain dished out to the Israeli side is ratcheting up, with videos published by Hezbollah embarrassingly refuting Israel‚Äôs previous claims that no soldiers have died on the northern front. Above all, Hezbollah‚Äôs chief success has been in forcing over [100,000 Jews](https://thecradle.co/articles/hezbollah-missiles-prevent-return-of-settlers-in-israels-north) on Lebanon‚Äôs border to evacuate to the center of the country. Hezbollah has targeted Jewish residential settlements in retaliation for Israeli attacks on Lebanese and Palestinian civilians, adding a whole new dimension to this conflict. The irony of Jews who forced the Palestinian people to live as refugees being forced out of their homes to go live in camps themselves is a devastating blow to the central promise of the Zionist project: Jews are allowed to live anywhere they want, including on other people‚Äôs land. Most analysts believe that Biden‚Äôs promise of a new doctrine of extreme measures do not include a strike on Iranian territory due to the high probability that [America would lose](https://www.popularmechanics.com/military/a30392654/millennium-challenge-qassem-soleimani/). This is debatable, as Washington‚Äôs support for Israel is not grounded in the laws of ordinary geopolitical reasoning. If a formal US attack on Iranian territory is off the table, observers should switch their attention to Netanyahu‚Äôs chilling [threats](https://apnews.com/article/israel-lebanon-hezbollah-war-preparedness-civilians-military-aafd7a0048dceb810456b93ceecf543c) to turn ‚ÄúBeirut into Gaza.‚Äù There are many downsides to an Israeli offensive into Lebanon. A war with Hezbollah would outright threaten the Zionist state with extinction without significant American intervention ‚Äî which is basically guaranteed ‚Äî on its behalf. The Lebanese militia [possesses](https://www.forbes.com/sites/erictegler/2023/11/15/hezbollahs-rocket-missile-and-drone-arsenal-is-huge-and-varied/?sh=7de642762d21) supersonic missiles, suicide drones, and precision Fattah ballistic missiles that could unleash devastation on Haifa and Tel Aviv. It is believed that if the current skirmishes were to grow hotter, Hezbollah would overwhelm the Iron Dome with massive barrages of cheap bait rockets, which would then leave the Jewish state‚Äôs defenses vulnerable to more advanced and deadly weaponry. Thus far, Hezbollah has had no kinetic interaction with the United States, but the US Treasury Department has still targeted them with [ new sanctions](https://english.alarabiya.net/News/middle-east/2024/01/31/US-issues-Iran-related-sanctions-on-companies-based-in-Lebanon-Turkey). French and American attempts at strategically isolating Hezbollah within Lebanon, primarily through the funding of the Lebanese military as a counter-balance, have been unsuccessful due to laws mandating Hezbollah-sympathetic Shi‚Äôite representation in the multi-confessional national armed forces. Historically, [French and US attempts](https://www.marinecorpstimes.com/news/your-marine-corps/2023/10/23/40-years-after-beirut-how-the-bombing-still-haunts-the-corps-today/) to intervene in Lebanon in hopes of tilting the scales in favor of Israel have proven unsustainable and culminated in disaster. For Israel to have a chance against Hezbollah, the United States will be forced to prioritize a temporary end to hostilities in Gaza while intensifying action against Iran‚Äôs less powerful allies in Yemen, Iraq and Syria. Washington may also seek to focus on disrupting the supply route from Iran to Hezbollah. This will remain a challenge. The sole advantage Israel and the US have over Iran and its affiliates is the prospect of a pre-emptive nuclear strike, but Iran has developed its [nuclear program](https://www.iranintl.com/en/202401172896) to the point of being able to manufacture these weapons with two weeks notice. Going forward, every US-Israel scenario is painful, save for common sense diplomacy. If Biden fails to advance Israel‚Äôs bellicose objectives with his next moves, the Jewish lobby will do everything in their power to ensure he is not re-elected. [Substack](https://littoria.substack.com/p/israel-is-losing-their-war-but-what)by permission of author or representative) [Foreign Policy](/category/foreign-policy/)‚Ä¢ Tags: [American Military](/topic/american-military/), [Gaza](/topic/gaza/), [Hamas](/topic/hamas/), [Hezbollah](/topic/hezbollah/), [Iran](/topic/iran/), [Israel/Palestine](/topic/israel-palestine/), [Syria](/topic/syria/), [The Middle East](/topic/the-middle-east/)

author: EFE
title: Mar√≠a Corina Machado rechaz√≥ propuesta de nuevas elecciones y de un Gobierno de coalici√≥n
text:
El presidente brasile√±o, Luiz In√°cio Lula da Silva, sugiri√≥ este jueves dos posibles salidas a la crisis postelectoral en Venezuela: la formaci√≥n de un Gobierno de coalici√≥n que integre miembros del chavismo y de la oposici√≥n, o la celebraci√≥n de nuevos comicios.
La l√≠der de la oposici√≥n venezolana, Mar√≠a Corina Machado, rechaz√≥ este jueves la propuesta de Brasil de que se celebren nuevas elecciones o se forme un Gobierno de coalici√≥n, e insisti√≥ en que los resultados que dieron ganador a Nicol√°s Maduro en las presidenciales son fraudulentos.
‚ÄúLas elecciones tuvieron lugar y la sociedad venezolana se expres√≥ en condiciones muy adversas, donde hubo fraude y aun as√≠ logramos ganar‚Äù, respondi√≥ Machado en una rueda de prensa virtual con medios en Argentina y Chile.
‚ÄúHay que respetar la voz del pueblo, hay que respetar la soberan√≠a. (‚Ä¶) ¬øAceptar√≠an ustedes que se llamara a otra elecci√≥n en sus respectivos pa√≠ses?‚Äù,agreg√≥.
Machado destac√≥ adem√°s que ‚Äúlas elecciones las definen los votos, no los acuerdos de c√∫pulas‚Äù.
La propuesta de Brasil El Consejo Nacional Electoral (CNE) proclam√≥ a Maduro vencedor, pero Machado insisti√≥ este jueves en ‚Äúla victoria monumental‚Äù del opositor Edmundo Gonz√°lez Urrutia con 7,3 millones de votos -casi el 84 % de las actas-, contra los 3,3 millones de votos que dijo obtuvo Maduro.
El presidente brasile√±o, Luiz In√°cio Lula da Silva, sugiri√≥ este jueves dos posibles salidas a la crisis postelectoral en Venezuela: la formaci√≥n de un Gobierno de coalici√≥n que integre miembros del chavismo y de la oposici√≥n o la celebraci√≥n de nuevos comicios.
Esta √∫ltima iniciativa la apoy√≥ su par estadounidense, Joe Biden, pero la rechaz√≥ el Gobierno de M√©xico. Mientras que el presidente colombiano, Gustavo Petro, sugiri√≥ para Venezuela un ‚Äúfrente nacional‚Äù como el que hubo en su pa√≠s en el siglo XX, en el que liberales y conservadores se turnaban el poder como paso ‚Äútransitorio‚Äù hacia una ‚Äúsoluci√≥n definitiva‚Äù a la crisis.
‚ÄúSe va a una segunda elecci√≥n, y si no le gusta las resultados ¬øse va a una tercera, cuarta, quinta, hasta que le gusten los resultados a Maduro? ¬øAceptar√≠an eso en su pa√≠s?‚Äù, se pregunt√≥ Machado.
‚ÄúDesconocer‚Äù las elecciones del 28 de junio ‚Äúes una falta de respeto a los venezolanos que han dado todo. La soberan√≠a popular se respeta. Las elecciones ya ocurrieron‚Äù, afirm√≥.
El r√©gimen se ha negado a negociar la transici√≥n Respecto a la idea de un Gobierno de coalici√≥n, pidi√≥ ‚Äútener mucho cuidado‚Äù porque diferenci√≥ los ejemplos en otros pa√≠ses donde los partidos tienen ‚Äúdiferencias de orden pol√≠tico‚Äù pero ‚Äúhan sido democr√°ticos o no han sido involucrados en casos criminales‚Äù.
Machado record√≥ que su agrupaci√≥n ofrece ‚Äúincentivos y salvaguardas‚Äù a los oficialistas que quieran acercarse a sus filas para lograr una transici√≥n democr√°tica de cara a una asunci√≥n de Gonz√°lez Urrutia el 10 de enero pr√≥ximo, a los que promete que no habr√° ‚Äúpersecuci√≥n‚Äù ni ‚Äúvenganza‚Äù.
‚ÄúEstamos dispuestos‚Äù, pero ‚Äúel r√©gimen se ha negado hasta ahora‚Äù a negociar la transici√≥n, se√±al√≥.
Despu√©s de las elecciones en Venezuela, los Gobiernos de Brasil, Colombia y M√©xico iniciaron contactos para encontrar una soluci√≥n a la crisis, un esfuerzo de mediaci√≥n que cuenta entre otros con el respaldo de Estados Unidos.

author: cue
title: England's Tuilagi to miss Six Nations start due to groin injury | The Straits Times
text:
England's Sale Sharks centre Manu Tuilagi is set to miss the start of next year's Six Nations as he recovers from a groin injury, the Premiership Rugby club said on Thursday.
Tuilagi, who has played 60 times for England, has suffered with groin issues during his career and limped off early in the second half of Sale's victory over Saracens on Friday.
Sale Director of Rugby, Alex Sanderson, said the 32-year-old will not be ready for England's opener against Italy in Rome on Feb. 3 but added that the injury would not require surgery.
"Manu has pulled his groin, and we think he's going to be back during the Six Nations, but not for the first week," Sanderson was quoted as saying by British media.
"He was in the frame before and I've stated before his intent to keep playing international rugby."
Sale prop Bevan Rodd will be sidelined for the whole of the Six Nations tournament after having surgery on his toe. REUTERS
Join ST's Telegram channel and get the latest breaking news delivered to you.
